title: Tool Control & Management System
description:
Comprehensive tool control system for Consoul TUI, giving users fine-grained control over which AI tools are available.

## Problem Statement

Currently, Consoul TUI registers all 13 tools automatically with no user control. The allowed_tools config exists but only blocks execution (not registration), creating a registration vs. execution gap. Users cannot:
- Limit AI capabilities to specific tool sets
- Run chat-only mode without tools
- See which tools are currently available
- Control tools at runtime without restarting

## Solution

Multi-layer tool control system:

**Layer 1: Configuration** - Control via config file (allowed_tools, risk_filter)
**Layer 2: CLI Flags** - Session-based control (--tools flag)
**Layer 3: Interactive UI** - Runtime management (Tool Manager screen)
**Layer 4: Presets** - Quick workflow switching (readonly, development, etc.)

## Benefits

- **Security**: Users can restrict AI to safe read-only tools
- **Context Efficiency**: Only register needed tools (smaller context)
- **Flexibility**: Per-session tool control via CLI
- **Visibility**: See what tools are enabled
- **UX**: Quick presets for common workflows
- **Consistency**: Aligns TUI with SDK behavior

## Phases

**Phase 1 (Critical)**: Foundation - Config and CLI control
**Phase 2 (Important)**: Visibility - Status indicator and Tool Manager
**Phase 3 (Nice-to-Have)**: Power features - Presets and persistence

## Success Metrics

- Users can control tool registration via config
- Users can override via CLI flag
- Users see tool status in TUI
- Users can manage tools interactively
- All changes are backward compatible
